experienceSection.title: We speak from
experienceSection.quote: "First paycheck, spent it all, month over – and then came the bills, late notices, and debt. Nobody ever taught us how money really works."
experienceSection.paragraph1: We were apprentices ourselves – young, excited, finally earning our own money. But without knowing anything about budgets, saving, or contracts, we burned through every cent. Overdrafts, installment traps, subscription pitfalls. What started as freedom quickly turned into real stress: sleepless nights, shame, and the feeling of being completely alone with it.
experienceSection.paragraph2: That exact feeling was the spark behind BeAFox. We don't want the next generation to repeat these mistakes. So we built an app that teaches financial knowledge the way we wished someone had taught us back then: honestly, clearly, and without judgment.
experienceSection.paragraph3: If even one person makes one fewer mistake because of BeAFox – it was all worth it.

items.question: Are there rewards or progress indicators?
items.answer: Yes! You can earn points, complete missions and track your progress at any time – learning made fun. The gamified system motivates you to learn continuously and improve your financial literacy.

items.question: How much does BeAFox cost for educational institutions?
items.answer: To make financial education accessible to all students, we offer fair, tiered pricing for schools. For schools the price is €1 per student per year. For businesses we offer tiered pricing from 10 licenses from €3.99 per month. Contact us for a custom quote.

items.question: Is there a teacher or admin access?
items.answer: Yes, for teachers, trainers and admins we offer a comprehensive dashboard where you can create student accounts, manage classes and view participants' learning progress in detail. The dashboard also provides analytics and reports.

items.question: Is BeAFox really independent and neutral?
items.answer: Yes, absolutely! We focus purely on knowledge transfer. No financial products are promoted in the app, so the content feels honest and trustworthy. Our mission is to provide real financial education, not to sell products.

items.question: How does the gamified system work?
items.answer: With a gamified system of points, missions, rewards and leaderboards, learning no longer feels like a chore. Students stay motivated and learn sustainably. You can level up, unlock achievements and compete with others.

items.question: Can I use BeAFox as an individual?
items.answer: Yes! BeAFox is also available to individuals. You get full access to all lessons and can learn at your own pace. We offer different subscription models: Monthly (€4.99), annual (€3.99/month) or lifetime (€49.99 one-time).

items.question: How evidence-based is BeAFox?
items.answer: We use evidence-based teaching methods to create lessons that successfully improve your financial knowledge. Our research project with over 500 participants has shown that our methods work. Content is developed by financial experts and educators.

items.question: What is the difference between BeAFox for Schools and BeAFox for Business?
items.answer: BeAFox for Schools targets educational institutions and offers a monitoring dashboard for teachers. BeAFox for Business targets training companies and additionally includes regular workshops (every 6 months), official certificates and extended reporting.

items.question: Can I try BeAFox before buying?
items.answer: Yes, we're happy to offer a free trial. Contact us for more information and a demo. Schools can start a pilot project to try BeAFox with no obligation.

items.question: How often is new content added?
items.answer: We continuously work on new lessons and features. All users receive regular updates with new content and improvements. Our goal is to publish new lessons monthly and larger feature updates quarterly.

items.question: Is there support if I have questions?
items.answer: Yes, our support is there for you around the clock and will answer your requests as quickly and helpfully as possible. Contact us anytime via email, the contact form or directly in the app!

items.question: Does BeAFox work on all devices?
items.answer: BeAFox is available as an app for iOS and Android. The monitoring dashboard for teachers and trainers works in the browser on all devices (desktop, tablet, smartphone). The app syncs your progress automatically across devices.

items.question: How secure is my data?
items.answer: Data protection and security are our top priorities. We use modern encryption and strictly comply with GDPR. Your data is stored securely and never shared with third parties.

items.question: Can I export my progress?
items.answer: Yes, you can export your progress and certificates at any time. For schools and businesses we also offer detailed reports and analytics as PDF or Excel export.

items.question: Are there workshops or training sessions?
items.answer: Yes! We offer interactive financial education workshops for schools, companies and associations. Workshops can be held on-site or online and are led by experienced facilitators. Contact us for more information.

items.question: What is included in the price?
items.answer: The price includes full app access, all learning modules, monitoring dashboards (for schools/businesses), support and regular updates. Business packages also include workshops and certificates.

items.question: Can I cancel anytime?
items.answer: For individuals: The monthly subscription can be cancelled at any time. Annual subscriptions run for the agreed term. For schools and businesses, individual agreements apply and can be flexible.

items.question: Are there discounts for multiple classes or locations?
items.answer: Yes, we offer tiered pricing for larger institutions. The more students or employees, the lower the price per person. Contact us for a custom offer tailored to your needs.

specialMoments.title: We won!
specialMoments.description: We’re proud to have won the Deggendorfer Gründerpreis! Despite nerves and a last-minute pitch update, our work paid off—around 60% of the audience voted for us. Thanks to the whole team for the great organization and the €2,500 prize. We’re excited for the next steps with BeAFox!

specialMoments.title: BeAFox at Ed.One in Munich!
specialMoments.description: This is what financial education feels like in the classroom. At the Ed.One Summit in Munich, students, teachers, and trainers tested BeAFox live—from the dashboard to the learning app and worksheets. We received valuable feedback, made exciting connections, and presented our pitch. BeAFox shows how simple financial education can be. We’re looking for you!

specialMoments.title: BeAFox wins Startup Summit!
specialMoments.description: BeAFox achieved 2nd place at Startup Summit Germany—our first official award! For the first time, we pitched as a duo with a new pitch, deck, and an even clearer vision. After two years of hard work, it shows that perseverance, courage, and teamwork pay off. Thanks to Volksbank am Württemberg eG for this great event!

articles.title: Startchancen program
articles.description: Big news: BeAFox is part of the Startchancen program! This allows schools to fully fund our learning app through subsidies. For us, it’s a strong signal that financial education belongs in everyday school life. Many of us would have loved an offer like this in school—practical, playful, and relevant. Now we can reach schools that previously had little access to such opportunities, bringing us closer to real equal opportunities.

articles.title: Rütteltest with the Economic Junior Chamber Regensburg
articles.description: At the Rütteltest of the Wirtschaftsjunioren Regensburg we pitched BeAFox for over 20 minutes and then received more than an hour of honest, in-depth feedback from six experts. Our entire business model was constructively challenged—exactly what we wanted. We’re taking away many impulses, set new priorities, and decided to join the organization right away. An experience we recommend to any startup.

articles.title: Our first workshop.
articles.description: Our first financial education workshop for apprentices—combined with the BeAFox app—was a great success. Instead of one-off theory, we focus on practical exercises: building personal budgets, opening a brokerage account, planning first investments, understanding insurance, and using a tax return. The best part: with BeAFox, participants can keep learning after the workshop and deepen their knowledge. Companies get a sustainable education offering.

articles.title: BeAFox at DemoNight in Nuremberg
articles.description: BeAFox at BayStartup’s DemoNight in Nuremberg: right when we arrived, a founder approached us who knew us from social media—a small moment that motivated us a lot. The evening was full of exciting conversations, new contacts, and innovative ideas. Events like this remind us why we build BeAFox: to solve real problems and bring financial education to where it truly matters in young people’s everyday lives.

articles.title: What an experience: YFC
articles.description: What an experience: we attended YFC in Munich with BeAFox, the first conference of the Young Founders Network. Between inspiring speakers, many startups, and great networking, we showcased our learning app at our own booth. The organization, atmosphere, and conversations impressed us. A special highlight: the announcement of the Young Founders Fund—a chance we definitely want to pursue.

articles.title: BeAFox at the Summit of the Entrepreneurship Foundation
articles.description: BeAFox at the Summit of the Stiftung Entrepreneurship in Berlin—an inspiring weekend. Again and again we heard: “Financial education is important!” and felt how big the need for modern solutions is. We presented our app, received consistently positive feedback, and had intense conversations with people who take the topic as seriously as we do. This event strengthened our vision even more.

articles.title: BeAFox at the BÖB Congress
articles.description: At the congress of Bündnis Ökonomische Bildung Deutschland, there was a lot of discussion about making financial education a standalone school subject—with new textbooks, courses, and training. I asked: is that really enough? With teacher shortages and a topic many people avoid talking about? I believe we also need new paths: digital tools, gamification, and project-based learning. That’s exactly where BeAFox comes in—as a complement, not a competitor to teaching.

articles.title: We did it
articles.description: With BeAFox we achieved 2nd place at Startup Summit Germany! Our first team pitch together, a new deck, a new concept—and an award including prize money. After two intense years of testing, discarding, and improving, this moment feels like a strong sign: our idea works. A huge thank you to everyone supporting us and to Volksbank am Württemberg eG.

articles.title: I pitched BeAFox at Innovation Day
articles.description: My first pitch in English—five minutes at Innovation Day in front of an international audience. Even though we didn’t win this time, it was an incredibly valuable experience. I presented BeAFox on a new stage, gained new perspectives on financial education, and made many exciting connections. Moments like these show how important it is to be brave, try new things, and continuously improve.

articles.title: BeAFox at ChamlandSchau
articles.description: Left school at 18, no plan for life, and built up debt—that’s how my story began. Today I’ve learned how to handle money and built a startup with BeAFox that tackles exactly that. At ChamlandSchau, our small booth stood among big companies—and still we had nonstop conversations. It shows: young people feel that financial education is missing and are looking for answers.

articles.title: Release in App Store & Play Store
articles.description: It’s happening: BeAFox is officially available in the App Store and Play Store! After more than 1.5 years of development, testing, and countless adjustments, we went live—three months earlier than planned. Our goal: make financial education as simple and accessible as possible, without ads or hidden sales interests. Now every download, every feedback, and every recommendation helps us reach more young people.

articles.title: Donau-Post article
articles.description: BeAFox in the newspaper—this time with a very special headline: “We need to talk about money!” Donau-Post published an in-depth article about us and how an idea became a real learning offer for schools. After 1.5 years of work, doubts, and many late nights, this moment is special. It shows that the time invested pays off—and our mission is reaching more and more people.

articles.title: A new logo for BeAFox
articles.description: Feedback is gold: our first logo felt improvised and not professional enough—so we acted. Together with a designer, we created a new BeAFox logo: more modern, clear, friendly, and perfectly aligned with our target group. For us this is more than a design update. It’s a symbol of how seriously we take our mission and how important a consistent brand presence is for schools, companies, and users.

articles.title: Mittelbayerische Zeitung
articles.description: “From smartphone to finance fox” — that was the headline of our first major article in Mittelbayerische Zeitung. A goosebump moment to see our vision in print. Focus: why financial education is so important for young people, how BeAFox supports teachers in class, and why we intentionally stay independent from ads and sales interests. A huge thank you to everyone involved!

articles.title: BeAFox in the classroom for the first time
articles.description: Today was special: BeAFox was used in real class for the first time—at the State Secondary School Neutraubling. Together with 25 students we tried financial education with the app. Result: 24 out of 25 want BeAFox to be a fixed part of their lessons. For us, a strong signal that young people want digital, interactive formats—and that our approach fits the classroom.

articles.title: Another successful pitch for BeAFox
articles.description: At Ideenpitch Region Nürnberg we presented BeAFox outside Regensburg for the first time. The improved pitch was well received and helped make our idea clearer and more tangible. We especially enjoyed the many conversations with people from education and business. Our goal: bring BeAFox to schools in time for the Bavarian school start—so financial education finally arrives where it belongs.

articles.title: My first pitch — in front of 200+ people
articles.description: My very first pitch—and straight away in front of more than 200 people at the “Tigers” of TechBase Regensburg! I presented our BeAFox vision, why financial education is so important for young people, and how our app addresses that gap. The conversations afterward were especially valuable: teachers, students, and companies recognized themselves in the story and showed interest in collaborating.

articles.title: It’s official. We went to the notary
articles.description: BeAFox is officially founded: we went to the notary and signed the articles of association—a major milestone after months of ideas, feedback, and testing. Our goal remains clear: make financial education understandable, independent, and playful for young people. Next up: trademark registration, more pilot projects with schools and companies, and the next big step toward a breakthrough.

articles.title: What a day: DENK.Summit
articles.description: With BeAFox we presented our startup in the startup area of DENK.Summit—with overwhelmingly positive feedback: “insanely beautiful booth”, “cool branding, you really stand out”. In just two hours, 50+ pupils and students tested the app. Almost everyone confirmed: financial education barely happens in schools today. This experience once again showed us how important our mission is.
